verses.roman:
rātula vastra dekhi' paṇḍita premāviṣṭa ha-ilā
'mahāprabhura prasāda' jāni' tāṅhāre puchilā

synonyms: rātula—red; vastra—cloth; dekhi'-seeing; paṇḍita—Jagadānanda Paṇḍita; prema-āviṣṭa ha-ilā—became overwhelmed in ecstatic love; mahāprabhura prasāda—the blessed gift of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; jāni'-thinking; tāṅhāre puchilā—inquired from him.
translation: Assuming the reddish cloth to be a gift from Caitanya Mahāprabhu, Jagadānanda Paṇḍita was overwhelmed with ecstatic love. Thus he questioned Sanātana Gosvāmī.
